replies.bodyText:
Missed this before somehow. Anyways adding "com" and "coremod" is adding megabytes onto the lang files all up, and is not really current convention. So do you want "gui.minecolonies.field..." instead?
Also quite happy to do a PR to tidy up all these lang files (removing deprecation, sort in order, etc). Not that hard with project-wide find-and-replace.
replies.author: ShadowProtocol

replies.bodyText: that's up to you, ideally, it should start/contain modid to prevent collisions with everything else
replies.author: Nightenom

replies.bodyText: btw do not sort them, and we should be adding them to the end of the file, removing is fine, beware of project replace as it usually replaces more than you need :D
replies.author: Nightenom

replies.bodyText: Alright then, gui.minecolonies it is. And I never use project replace without regex, to be ultra careful :)
replies.author: ShadowProtocol

replies.bodyText: Make it the default com.minecolonies.coremod.gui, those few extra bytes in exchange for consistency. Maybe we rename them in the future to a shorter one. But for now that's the full gradle modid.
replies.author: Raycoms

replies.bodyText: Not that gradle really has anything to do with the games I18n at all. I'll put them with the full thing then for now, but I would like to change them all in another tidy up PR if there's no big objections. It has no advantages being like this, and to me looks kinda messy. (and if someone's offering to clean up for free, wouldn't you take it? :D)
replies.author: ShadowProtocol

replies.bodyText: We can clean those up when we drop 1.15 support. If you do this now, this will lead to massive conflicts with 1.16 potentially =D
replies.author: Raycoms
